channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: New '0APT' Extortion Group Fakes Data Breach in Bluff Attack on Australian Hospital
item.description:
A new extortion group calling itself '0APT' has targeted Australia's Epworth HealthCare, claiming to have stolen 920GB of sensitive patient and financial data. The group listed the hospital on its darknet leak site on February 4, 2026, threatening to publish the data if a ransom was not paid. Howeve...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Nationwide Outage: BridgePay Payment Gateway Confirms Ransomware Attack Crippled Production Systems
item.description:
U.S. payment gateway provider BridgePay Network Solutions has confirmed a ransomware attack was the cause of a massive service outage that began on February 6, 2026. The attack took down numerous production systems, including the BridgePay Gateway API, virtual terminals, and hosted payment pages, di...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Education Sector Slowed in 2025, But U.S. Remains Top Target
item.description:
A 2025 report from Comparitech indicates a slowdown in the growth of ransomware attacks against the global education sector. There were 251 attacks recorded worldwide, a slight 2% increase from the previous year. These incidents resulted in at least 3.96 million breached records. The United States w...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Betterment Data Breach Exposes 1.4M Customers After Social Engineering Attack
item.description:
Automated investment platform Betterment has disclosed a data breach affecting 1.4 million customers, originating from a sophisticated social engineering attack. Threat actors, claiming to be the 'ShinyHunters' group, used voice phishing (vishing) to manipulate employees and steal Okta single sign-o...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Substack Discloses Data Breach Exposing User Contact Information
item.description:
The newsletter platform Substack has announced it suffered a data breach after discovering on February 3, 2026, that an unauthorized party had gained access to a database containing user information. The exposed data includes names, email addresses, phone numbers, and Stripe IDs, though the company ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cloud Security

item.title: Massive AT&T Customer Dataset with 148M SSNs Resurfaces in Criminal Circles
item.description:
A massive and highly sensitive dataset allegedly containing the personal information of AT&T customers has resurfaced and is being circulated in criminal forums. The data trove reportedly includes approximately 176 million records, featuring over 133 million full names and addresses, and, most criti...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Claims Breach of Tulsa International Airport, Leaks Data
item.description:
The Russian-affiliated Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Tulsa International Airport. The group has listed the airport on its data leak site, alleging the theft of sensitive data including financial records and employee information. While airport operations ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Sophisticated Phishing Attack Uses PDF Lures and Cloud Services to Steal Dropbox Credentials
item.description:
A new, multi-stage phishing campaign is using procurement-themed emails with benign-looking PDF attachments to bypass email security filters. The attack chain redirects victims through a legitimate cloud service, Vercel Blob, before presenting a convincing fake Dropbox login page. The goal is to har...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Canada Computers Discloses Data Breach Affecting Guest Checkout Customers
item.description:
Canada Computers Inc., a major Canadian electronics retailer, has announced a data breach that exposed the personal and credit card information of customers. The incident affected individuals who used the 'guest' checkout feature on the company's website between December 29, 2025, and January 22, 20...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Ransomware

item.title: Play Ransomware Hits US Instrument Manufacturer Deatak in Data Breach
item.description:
The Play ransomware group has claimed another victim in the manufacturing sector, listing U.S.-based instrument maker Deatak on its data breach forum. The attackers allege they have compromised and exfiltrated a wide range of private and confidential data, including client documents, employee payrol...

Severity: High
